author: Hipertextual (Redacción)
title: Lejos de desaparecer, los datos demuestran que el trabajo híbrido funciona
text: “Hoy trabajo desde casa”. Abres el chat de la oficina y ves que a un par de compañeros les ha surgido un imprevisto y deciden trabajar desde casa. Lo que hace unos años era impensable, ahora es algo a lo que apenas se le da importancia gracias al nuevo modelo de trabajo híbrido que han adoptado la gran mayoría de empresas. Esta nueva forma de trabajar tiene tanta aceptación que, según un informe realizado por IDC, el 100% de las empresas preguntadas han adoptado o tienen pensado adoptar un modelo de trabajo híbrido. Pese a que en los últimos meses se ha estado hablando de que el teletrabajo tiene los días contados y que cada vez más empresas promueven el trabajo estrictamente presencial, nada más lejos de la realidad. El teletrabajo o el formato híbrido ha llegado para quedarse, y los datos son el mejor reflejo. Compañías como Lenovo son algunas de las que más han impulsado el trabajo remoto con un portfolio de equipos enorme para cada empresa y cada trabajador. El 75% de los empleados aseguran ser más productivos trabajando desde casa A nivel de compañía, para 2024 se espera que las empresas que hayan invertido en herramientas para fomentar un modelo de trabajo híbrido o cien por cien remoto, aumentarán sus beneficios en un 20%. Pero es que por parte de los empleados, también queda clara la preferencia. Un 75% de los empleados encuestados afirman que son incluso más productivos trabajando desde casa. Tanto los CIOs como los CEOs de las compañías establecen tres pilares básicos para favorecer el trabajo híbrido: coste, eficiencia y productividad. Por supuesto, para que esto funcione, deben ofrecer a sus empleados la posibilidad de trabajar desde cualquier lado con las mismas características, tanto en equipos como a nivel de seguridad. Cómo ayuda Lenovo a fomentar el trabajo híbrido Con la implementación de tecnología adecuada, los empleados aumentan su competencia en sus roles y pueden enfocarse en tareas más significativas. Las soluciones flexibles, escalables y de fácil implementación de Lenovo para entornos de trabajo digital ayudan a alcanzar los objetivos de los empleados al mismo tiempo que liberan tiempo del equipo de IT. La elección de Lenovo no es casual ya que tiene una amplia experiencia en el sector. Marcas como ThinkPad han conseguido, por ejemplo, que Lenovo fuese la marca número uno en ordenadores para la oficina, según un informe de IDC. A esto se le suman otras soluciones como Lenovo ThinkShield, Lenovo ThinkSmart o Lenovo TruScale Device-as-a-Service (DaaS) perfectas para el entorno empresarial. Pero no sólo esto ya que Lenovo se apoya en varios partners estratégicos que ayudan a ofrecer una experiencia todavía mejor. Partners de primer nivel como Intel o Microsoft, este último, principalmente, de la mano de su última versión del sistema operativo más famoso del mundo: Windows 11. Lenovo y Microsoft: la mejor unión de software y hardware para el nuevo modelo de trabajo híbrido Windows 11 no sólo ha supuesto un cambio estético con respecto a sus antecesores, también presenta mejoras sustanciales en rendimiento y seguridad. Con una interfaz de usuario más pulida, un menú Inicio renovado y la integración de múltiples escritorios virtuales, Windows 11 brinda una experiencia intuitiva y fluida. Todos los equipos de Lenovo que se comercializan actualmente, lo hacen con alguna de las versiones de Windows 11. La combinación de la innovadora tecnología de Lenovo con las capacidades de Windows 11 ofrece un entorno de trabajo digital más eficiente y atractivo. Los dispositivos Lenovo también son capaces de sacar todo el partido y aprovechar al máximo las características de Windows 11, garantizando una experiencia sin igual. Además, con Windows 11, las aplicaciones de Microsoft, como Microsoft 365, Teams y Edge, se integran de manera más estrecha, proporcionando un ecosistema perfecto para mejorar la productividad y la colaboración en el ámbito empresarial. Por último, en cuanto a seguridad, Windows 11 refuerza la protección del sistema con características como la autenticación biométrica y la seguridad basada en hardware, proporcionando un entorno más seguro para los usuarios y sus datos. La pandemia que vivimos en 2020 que nos obligó a trabajar desde casa nos enseñó dos cosas: que invertir en tecnología por parte de las empresas es un acierto y que la oficina ha roto los límites físicos, dando como resultado empleados más contentos, más productivos y más involucrados al mismo tiempo que los beneficios de la empresa crecen.

author: Mariam Abdullahi
title: Support for Victims: Gov. Aliyu Allocates N100m to Sokoto Market Fire Victims
text:
In a recent development, Governor Ahmed Aliyu of Sokoto State has initiated the distribution of N100 million funds provided by the state government to individuals affected by the recent fire outbreak at the Sokoto central market.
The announcement was made in a statement released to the media on Saturday in Sokoto, as disclosed by the Governor’s Chief Press Secretary, Malam Abubakar Bawa.
Senator Sahabi Gada, serving as the Committee’s Chairman, represented Aliyu during the disbursement of financial aid, emphasizing that the recipients were categorized based on the extent of their losses.
The distribution involved giving N19 million to the most heavily impacted traders, with those facing lesser losses receiving N300,000 each.
Bawa further stated that the committee took meticulous steps to ensure that only genuine victims of the disaster benefitted from the support.
Quoting Gada, Bawa mentioned, “Our detailed assessment of the impacted areas is aimed at directing the assistance to the right individuals.”
Gada clarified, “The aid provided by the Governor is not about compensating but offering relief to those affected, aiding them in restarting their businesses.”
Gada urged the beneficiaries to utilize the financial assistance prudently to achieve the intended purpose.
He further highlighted the appreciation expressed by Alhaji Garba Gwazi, the Chairman of the Motorcycles Sellers Association in the state, towards Governor Aliyu for his compassionate gesture, underscoring his care and concern for the state’s residents.

author: Bill Schmarzo
title: Best practices for integrating AI and ESG strategies | TechTarget
text:
Adopting an environmental, social and governance framework can help businesses address the climate and ethical challenges that AI presents.
ESG refers to a framework or set of criteria designed to measure the effects of an organization's actions on the environment, society and its constituents. The ESG approach seeks to address several areas:
Environmental. How does the organization manage its natural resources, reduce its carbon footprint, mitigate environmental risks and contribute to the fight against climate change? Social. How does the organization treat its employees, customers, suppliers and communities? How does it promote diversity, inclusion, human rights and social responsibility? Governance. How does the organization conduct its business; ensure accountability, transparency and compliance; and address ethical dilemmas and conflicts of interest? ESG can also have a significant positive effect on an organization's long-term performance, reputation and value creation. Following an ESG framework can enhance competitive advantage and differentiation in the market by attracting and retaining customers, investors, employees and partners who value sustainability and ethics. In addition, it can improve operational efficiency and innovation by reducing costs, risks and waste, and fostering a culture of collaboration.
Moreover, an ESG framework can strengthen customer and constituent relationships and trust through thoughtful, relevant engagement. It can help organizations solicit feedback, address customer concerns and set expectations. Internal ESG guidelines also assist organizations in fulfilling their social and environmental obligations and commitments. Guidelines can ensure that organizations comply with relevant laws and regulations and that they contribute to global goals and initiatives, such as the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals .
To ensure that ESG delivers more meaningful, relevant, responsible and ethical outcomes, organizations must identify the variables that constitute their ESG aspirations. These variables should be integrated into an AI utility function that guides the actions and decisions of AI models, providing a clear path for achieving ESG goals.
ESG and the AI utility function An AI utility function consists of the variables, metrics and associated weights that guide an AI model's decisions, map probabilistic outcomes to utility values and measure decision effectiveness, enabling the model to continuously learn and adapt.
The AI utility function is the beating heart of an AI model. The model uses the utility function to guide its decisions and actions by comparing the expected values of different outcomes and choosing the action or decision that maximizes the expected value, based on the variables and their associated weights.
Creating an ESG-friendly AI utility function requires integrating several types of ESG measures into the model's algorithmic architecture:
Ethical metrics , such as charitable contributions, volunteering hours, pay equality, corporate social responsibility reporting and individual privacy protections. Environmental metrics , such as energy efficiency, carbon footprint, water usage, biodiversity impact and renewable energy usage. Social metrics , such as workforce diversity, equal employment opportunities, healthcare affordability, workplace safety and human rights adherence. Challenges of ESG from an AI perspective Identifying and prioritizing the ESG measures to integrate into the AI utility function is a complex process involving organizational and technical challenges.
A key organizational challenge is creating a culture of data literacy and data-driven decision-making, where the entire organization values, communicates and aligns with ESG measures. Collaborating across multiple stakeholders -- including senior leaders, business units, customers, employees and regulators -- is essential to define and validate the ESG variables and their weights in the AI utility function.
In addition, organizations must establish clear and measurable ESG goals and metrics that align with the business strategy. This includes balancing tradeoffs and conflicts among ESG variables and other criteria, such as profitability, efficiency and quality, as well as ensuring the accountability, transparency and compliance of AI models and their outcomes.
Tools like materiality matrices can be useful when deciding which of the many possible ESG goals to prioritize. On the technical side, challenges include collecting , preparing, cleaning, aggregating, integrating and analyzing ESG data from a wide variety of internal and external data sources. Developing AI models that incorporate ESG variables and their natural tradeoffs into the utility function is another potential hurdle. Finally, organizations must monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of the AI models on the ESG measures and update the utility function accordingly.
AI use cases in ESG Using AI to enhance ESG reporting can have beneficial outcomes in a variety of sectors:
Inventory and supply chain management. Incorporating ESG variables such as greenhouse gas emissions, water consumption and recycling rate into the AI utility function can help organizations minimize their carbon footprint and waste generation. Healthcare. Providers can use AI to improve patient care and outcomes while enhancing social responsibility and reputation. ESG variables to incorporate could include patient satisfaction, quality of care and ethical standards. Banking and finance. Financial institutions can use AI to enhance risk management and fraud detection, and can use variables such as compliance, accountability and trust to promote governance and transparency. Manufacturing. Manufacturers that use AI to optimize product design and development can improve environmental and social impact by incorporating ESG variables such as energy efficiency, material usage and waste reduction. Media. Media companies can use AI to personalize content and recommendations while ensuring diversity and inclusion by incorporating ESG variables such as representation, accessibility, quality and relevance. Nonprofits. A nonprofit organization that uses AI to enhance its fundraising and advocacy can advance its mission and vision by incorporating ESG variables such as impact, awareness, engagement and trust. Bill Schmarzo is the former CIO of Hitachi Vantara, where he was recognized for groundbreaking work in data science and automated machine learning. He has also worked at Dell EMC as CTO and as vice president of analytics at Yahoo. He has also written several books on big data.

author: Mirage News
title: Discover Fungi Wonders at Corinna Wilderness, Tasmania | Mirage News
text:
Corinna, Tasmania – March 2025 – Corinna Wilderness Lodge, located in the pristine Tarkine rainforest, is offering two exclusive "Fungus Lovers" packages this June for nature enthusiasts and photography lovers. Set against the stunning backdrop of Tasmania's untouched wilderness, guests can embark on a fascinating journey into the world of fungi, guided by expert mycologist Alison Pouliot and renowned photographer Luke O'Brien.
These eco-friendly retreats allow visitors to discover the region's rich fungal diversity, featuring species that can only be found in this remote corner of the world. The packages, designed to cater to both budding and experienced nature lovers, include guided fungi walks, photography workshops, and an immersive experience in the heart of the Tarkine rainforest.
Fungus Photography with Luke O'Brien – June 2025
From May 31 to June 3, 2025, the "Fungus Photography" package offers a three-night stay at Corinna Wilderness Village, where participants will join talented Tasmanian photographer Luke O'Brien. Renowned for his captivating images of Tasmania's fungi, O'Brien will teach guests how to capture the essence of these mysterious organisms. Over the course of three days, attendees will learn practical tips on camera settings, composition, and focus techniques while exploring the many trails surrounding Corinna during the peak of fungi season. There will also be an opportunity to edit and refine photographs in a group post-processing session.
Discover Fungi with Alison Pouliot – June 2025
From June 3 to June 6, 2025, the "Discover Fungi with an Expert Mycologist" package invites guests to explore the wonders of the fungal kingdom with renowned mycologist Alison Pouliot. Pouliot, an expert in the ecology and cultural significance of fungi, will guide participants on interactive walks through the Tarkine Rainforest, offering insights into the crucial ecological role fungi play in this vibrant ecosystem. Attendees will uncover the fascinating biology, cultural connections, and environmental importance of fungi in hands-on seminars and rainforest forays.
Package Details & Pricing
Accommodation for both events is in Corinna's cozy, eco-friendly cabins. The Fungi Lovers 3-Night Stay package prices are as follows:
- Queen Cottage (1 Person): $1149
- Queen Cottage (2 Persons): $1371
- Family Cottage (2 Persons): $1554
- Family Cottage (3 Persons): $1776
- Family Cottage (4 Persons): $1998
Note: Additional costs may apply for optional activities like kayaking or scenic cruises during your stay.
Booking and Enquiries
Spaces are limited for these exclusive packages, so early booking is recommended.

author: armenpress.am
title: Le ministre croate des Affaires étrangères se félicite des contacts directs entre l'Arménie et l'Azerbaïdjan | ARMENPRESS Armenian News Agency
text:
EREVAN, 19 JANVIER, ARMENPRESS: Le ministre des Affaires étrangères de l'Arménie Ararat Mirzoyan et le ministre des Affaires étrangères de la Croatie Gordan Grlić Radman ont discuté de questions liées au renforcement de la coopération entre les deux pays.
Le ministère des Affaires étrangères de Croatie a publié une déclaration résumant les résultats de la réunion entre les ministres des Affaires étrangères des deux pays.
Le ministre croate des Affaires étrangères a souligné l'importance de la coopération bilatérale et s'est félicité des relations parlementaires et judiciaires bien établies. L'intérêt mutuel pour le renforcement de la coopération économique entre la Croatie et l'Arménie a également été souligné.
Le ministre Grlić Radman a noté l'augmentation des exportations vers l'Arménie pour la deuxième année consécutive, soulignant le potentiel existant dans les domaines des technologies de l'information, des infrastructures de transport, de la transition vers les technologies vertes et numériques, de l'industrie pharmaceutique et du déminage.
Le ministre Radman a également souligné le soutien constant de l'UE aux efforts visant à instaurer une paix stable et durable entre l'Arménie et l'Azerbaïdjan, sur la base des principes de souveraineté, d'inviolabilité des frontières et d'intégrité territoriale.
"Je suis heureux que l'Arménie apprécie les efforts déployés par l'UE au plus haut niveau pour promouvoir la normalisation des relations entre l'Arménie et l'Azerbaïdjan. Cependant, nous avons besoin des efforts conjoints de tous les acteurs. En ce sens, je salue particulièrement les contacts directs entre l'Arménie et l'Azerbaïdjan, qui constituent des étapes vers la conclusion d'un accord de paix", a conclu le ministre croate des affaires étrangères.
